data.title: Boston Marathon start times: When will runners cross the finish line?
data.meta_description: Professional men running are expected to finish around 11:30 a.m., and the pro women will finish just before noon.
data.text:
Professional men running are expected to finish around 11:30 a.m., and the pro women will finish just before noon.

Thousands of runners will be running from Hopkinton to Copley Square in Boston on Patriots Day — but they can’t all start at the same time.

Whether you’re tracking a friend or just attending the race, here’s all you need to know about the 2024 Boston Marathon start times.

Before the waves of open division runners, athletes with wheelchairs will kick off the competition around 9 a.m. Then, handcycles and duos, professionals, and para athletes will all take off before 10 a.m. The four waves of runners will line up in corrals for a 10 to 11:15 a.m. start.

Start times in Hopkinton

9:02 a.m. – Men’s Wheelchair

9:05 a.m. – Women’s Wheelchair

9:30 a.m. – Handcycles & Duos

9:37 a.m. – Professional Men

9:47 a.m. – Professional Women

9:50 a.m. – Para Athletics Division

10 a.m. – Wave 1

10:25 a.m. – Wave 2

10:50 a.m. – Wave 3

11:15 a.m. – Wave 4

Heartbreak Hill in Newton

Professional and amateur runners alike struggle with Boston’s hilly course. Heartbreak Hill in Newton is always packed with fans — even some handing out pickles to runners.

Spectators can watch the runners conquer the 17 to 21 mile stretch of the marathon near Boston College and the Woodland MBTA stop.

Athletes in wheelchairs will be at the hill just after 10 a.m. Professional men will likely be there at 11:16 a.m., and the professional women shortly after at 11:40 a.m.

For the open division, it depends on the runner’s pace. Here’s how to track your favorite runner competing on Monday.

Finishing times in Copley Square

Athletes in wheelchairs will be the first to cross the finish line on Boylston Street after the 26.2 miles. The first men will be pulling in around 10:22 a.m., and the first women will finish about ten minutes later.

Spectators can catch the professionals crossing the finish line around noon. The men are expected to finish around 11:30 a.m., and the pro women will finish just before noon.
